3. A statement identifying the principals who would participate in
the proposed development and the nature and extent, or percen-
age, of each principal's interest in the development group.

4. A statement from the developer's legal counsel as towhether or
not the developer now has legal power and authority to acquire
Development Area 12 and develop it in accordance with the pro-
visions of the Proposed Form of Disposition Agreement, dated
May 18, 1965.

5. A statementof any relationships between the developer and par-
ent companies or subsidiaries that might also take part in the
development of Area 12.

6. Balance sheets prepared within the last six months for the de-
veloper and any parent company or subsidiary named inresponse
to item 5 above.

7. The names and addresses of bank references for the developer
and any other source of equity capital named in answer to item
B.2. above.

‘Y 'y

8. A general background summary of the developer's previous ex-
perience and any special qualifications which the developer has
to carry out the proposed development.

9. (Optional) Any written information which the developer cares to
give regarding special work which he has done to investigate
and measure the potential for his proposed development in
Charles Center.

‘.

D. INFORMATION ABOUT THE SPECIFIC DEVELOPMENT PROPOSED



1. A statementof the size and type of facilities which the developer
is prepared to construct under the terms set forth in the stand-
ards and controls. Also included here, and in the functional
layout sketches described below, should be any ideas that the
developer has for further enhancing the potential of Charles
Center.

2. Architectural drawings and outline specifications, prepared and

signed by the architects and/or engineers whom the developer
will employ, indicating the way in which the developer proposes
